brief_description: Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare Department launched the "Soil Testing Laboratory" scheme for the farmer on 01 April 2013.
detailed_description: **Description** - Soil Testing Lab - For analysing soil samples preceding the application of fertilizer in the correct dosage in farmers' field. **Objectives** - The analysis is free of cost of soil samples preceding application of fertilizers/ liming etc. for farmers along with distribution of Soil Health Card (SHC). **Mode of Selection of Beneficiary(s)** - Bonafide farmers have sufficient available cultivable land on a first come first served basis.
benefits: To provide soil testing services for farmers free of cost. Soil Health Card (SHC).

steps: Bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/Agriculture Circle.

documents_required: Farmer's Photo. Verification Form by the Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/Agriculture Circle. Bank Details (Account No., IFSC Code) of the applicant. Aadhaar Number (or alternative identification documents.
